questions.text: The Community medicine department set out to an urban community to raise awareness about the importance of hand hygiene in preventing infectious diseases. As part of the campaign, health educators plan to conduct workshops to educate community members about proper handwashing techniques and their benefits. Which of the following is not a principle of health education?
questions.solution:
Correct option: C) Authoritativeness

Explanation: Authoritativeness is not a principle of health education

  • Authoritative teaching often involves one-way communication. This may make the audience feel passive and less engaged.
  • People are more likely to absorb and act on information when they actively participate in the learning process.
  • An authoritarian manner can create a power imbalance and make the audience feel disrespected or mistrusted. Building trust is crucial for effective health education.

Principles of health education include:

1. Credibility (option B)

2. Interest (option A)

3. Participation

4. Motivation

5. Comprehension

6. Reinforcement

7. Learning by doing

8. Known to unknown

9. Setting an example

10. Good Human relations

11. Feedback. (option D)

12. Leaders

questions.text: A 35 y/o woman comes to the clinic concerned about vaccinating her child due to information she encountered online suggesting that vaccines cause severe side effects and are part of a government conspiracy. She mentions feeling very emotional and scared after reading several personal stories about vaccine injuries on social media. Which of the following is a feature of the propaganda she has encountered?
questions.solution:
Correct option: D) Appeals to emotion

Explanation:

  • The scenario described indicates that the woman has been influenced by propaganda, which is characterized by its use of emotional appeals to persuade individuals.
  • This includes using personal stories, fear, and conspiracy theories to evoke strong emotional responses, leading to fear and mistrust of vaccines.

Options A, B & C are features of Health education.

Health education is contrastingly different from propaganda in the following ways:

 

Health Education

Propaganda

Mode of acquisition

Actively acquired knowledge and skills (active thinking).

Knowledge (may be false or exaggerated) is instilled in people's minds (facts).

Develops
  • Reflective behaviour.
  • Trains people to use judgment before acting.
  • Individuality.
  • Personality.
  • Self-expression.
  • Reflexive behaviour.
  • Aims at impulsive action.
  • A standard pattern of attitudes and behaviours according to what would be used- a set pattern of behaviour.

Appeals to

Reason

Emotion

Knowledge acquisition

By self-reliant activity

Spoon-fed and received

Process centered on

Behaviour: Aims at developing favourable attitudes, habits, and skills.

Information: no changes of attitude- behaviour designed.

questions.text: A public health campaign aims to reduce smoking rates in a community. The campaign involves spreading awareness about the dangers of smoking, encouraging people to try quitting through support programs, and promoting the success stories of those who have quit. Which model of health education does this campaign best represent?
questions.solution:
Correct option: B) Motivation or adoption model

Explanation:

This campaign follows the phases of the motivation or adoption model of health education:

D) Behaviour modification is not a model of health education.

questions.text: A healthcare provider is conducting a patient interview and encounters several barriers to effective communication. Which of the following is not one of them?

choices.text: The patient is geriatric and belongs to a low socio-economic status.
The clinic is located in a busy area with constant traffic noise, making it hard to communicate.
The patient speaks a different language and has difficulty understanding the provider's instructions.
The patient appears distressed and anxious, making it difficult for them to concentrate on the conversation.

questions.solution:
Correct option: A) The patient is a geriatric person belonging to a low socio-economic status.

Explanation:

  • While age can sometimes affect communication due to sensory impairments or cognitive decline, it is not inherently considered a barrier unless it leads to specific impairments like hearing loss or dementia.
  • While socioeconomic factors can influence access to healthcare and health education materials, they are not typically classified as direct barriers to communication in the context of conveying health information.

Noise pollution is an example of Physical Barrier of communication(Option B)

Language barrier is an example of a Cultural Barrier of communication(Option C)

Emotional or psychological barriers such as distress and anxiety are examples of Psychological barriers.(Option D)

questions.text: The most effective method of educating the general public about how to perform CPR (Cardiopulmonary resuscitation) is:
questions.solution:
Correct option: B) Demonstration

Explanation:

A demonstration is a carefully prepared presentation to show how to perform a skill or procedure.

Here CPR is carried out step by step before the general public and the demonstrator ascertains that the audience understands how to perform it.

Reasons why the Demonstration method is highly effective in health education:

(a) Dramatizes by arousing interest

(b) Persuades the onlookers to adopt recommended practices

(c) Upholds the principles of "seeing is believing" and "learning by doing", and

(d) Can bring desirable changes in the behaviour about the use of the new practice.

Flashcards: This mode of communication primarily relies on visual information and may not provide the hands-on demonstration required for learning the technique of CPR.(Option A)

Lecture: While lectures may be effective for sharing knowledge, they might not be as suitable for demonstrating CPR in a patient with cardiac arrest as lectures will not provide the hands-on experience necessary for understanding the CPR Technique.(Option C)

Group Discussion: They are more focused on dialogue and may not provide the practical demonstration needed for performing CPR.(Option D)

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes the Delphi technique?

choices.text: A method of data collection where participants discuss and agree on a topic in person.
A qualitative research method that involves direct observation of participants in their natural environment.
A structured communication technique used in health research that relies on a panel of experts answering questionnaires in multiple rounds to achieve consensus.
A statistical analysis method used to interpret large datasets through the use of complex algorithms.

questions.solution:
Correct option: C) A structured communication technique used in health research that relies on a panel of experts answering questionnaires in multiple rounds to achieve consensus.

Explanation:

Delphi method is a structured communication method that depends on a panel of experts.

  • It involves gathering opinions from the panel of experts on a specific issue, summarizing their collective feedback, and repeating this process for several rounds.
  • After each round, the experts share their feedback and the reasoning behind their judgements anonymously. This feedback encourages experts to reconsider and potentially revise their earlier opinions based on the responses of other panel members.
  • Through this process, the range of responses tends to narrow, and the group will reach a consensus.

The Delphi method does not involve participants discussing the issues (Option A) or natural observation (Option B) or statistical analysis (Option D).

questions.text: Which counseling approach is used in family planning to provide structured and supportive communication to clients?
questions.solution:
Correct option: D) GATHER approach

Explanation:

The GATHER approach is employed in family planning counseling to offer supportive communication to clients when choosing contraceptive methods.

Previously, the cafeteria method involved offering a basket full of contraceptives.

The SPIKES approach is utilized when delivering bad news to patients or their families.

Flannel graph is a piece of flannel fabric with a series of pictures to help narrate stories and is used in health education.

Flipcharts consist of sequentially organized sheets, similar to a small calendar, presenting key health information through illustrations, diagrams, and text, making it easier to engage audiences during presentations and discussions.

questions.text: A group of 4 experts on cardiac health were invited to interact with an audience of about 100 members. However, they were not given any set agenda to speak upon nor did they have any set speeches. They are allowed to discuss among themselves during the event as well and there is no set order of speaking. What kind of event were they invited to?
questions.solution:
Correct option: A) Panel discussion

 

Explanation:

  • In a panel discussion, 4 to 8 persons who are qualified to talk/ discuss the topic sit and discuss a given problem or topic in front of a large group or audience, without a set agenda or order of speaking and with audience interaction at the end of the discussion.
  • Symposium: In contrast to a panel discussion, a symposium involves 4-8 experts talking on a given topic with set agendas, speeches, and an order of speaking. .(Option B)

Panel discussion

Symposium

4-8 experts

4-8 experts

Two-way or Socratic

Two-way or Socratic

No set agenda

Set agenda

Not set speeches

Set speeches

No set order of speaking

Set order of speaking

Audience is present

Audience is present

Experts can discuss among themselves (they can intervene in between)

Experts cannot intervene in between (they cannot discuss among themselves)

Feedback can be taken

Feedback can be taken

Workshop (Option C):

  • A workshop is a practical educational experience in which participants learn new skills or techniques over a series of four or more meetings.

Seminar (Option D):

  • A seminar is a lecture-style presentation where a speaker provides information on a particular subject and the audience is allowed to ask questions and participate in a discussion.
  • It has a set agenda and speech.
